metadata.notes: 66th Fighter Squadron was one of three squadrons (64th, 65th, 66th) in 57th Fighter Group. Unit deployed to Egypt July 1942 aboard USS Ranger with 72 new P-40F-1 Warhawks (24 per squadron). First combat operations October 1942 at El Alamein. Squadron operated from Landing Ground 174 (16 Sep-5 Nov 1942), then moved to Daba (5-8 Nov), then Sidi Hanaish (8 Nov onwards). First combat loss 4 November 1942 when Lt Robert Adams shot down by ground fire. Squadron earned Distinguished Unit Citation for operations 24 Oct 1942 to 17 Aug 1943. Aircraft variant confirmed as P-40F-1 (short-tail, Packard V-1650-1 Merlin engine, 699 produced). Commander name not found for 1942-Q4 period. Personnel estimates based on standard USAAF fighter squadron organization. 57th Fighter Group attached to Desert Air Force mid-September 1942, supporting British Eighth Army westward advance after El Alamein.
metadata.witw_validation: WITW _airgroup.csv database not found in sources directory. Unable to cross-reference squadron ID.

tier_1_sources_used: Wikipedia - Landing Ground 174 (operational dates, base locations)
History of War - 57th Fighter Group (deployment timeline, commanders)
tier_2_sources_used: Wikipedia - P-40 variants article (production blocks, technical details)
source_validation.corroboration_notes: Aircraft variant (Curtiss P-40F-1 Warhawk) verified through multiple sources including History of War article stating '57th Fighter Group equipped with short-tail P-40F-1s' and Wikipedia P-40 variants article confirming P-40F-1 as first production block (699 aircraft) with Packard V-1650-1 engine. Deployment of 72 P-40Fs aboard USS Ranger July 1942 corroborated across multiple sources. Landing Ground 174 as operational base 16 Sep-5 Nov 1942 confirmed by Wikipedia LG 174 article with specific dates. Battle participation at El Alamein and Libyan pursuit operations confirmed across multiple sources. Specific operational detail: 4 November 1942 first combat loss (Lt Robert Adams, ground fire) found in web search results. Group-level claims of 4 Macchi C.202s on 26 October 1942 attributed proportionally to squadrons. Squadron strength of ~25 aircraft per squadron calculated from 72 total aircraft / 3 squadrons deployment.
